body.p: I was one of the jury that tried Henry Stallings for a breach of the peace before M. P. Heady in September last he was fined thirty dollars which I then thought and still think was grievously excessive, Stallings is a Union man, there were a good many secessionists on the jury & it was political prejudice & revenge that carried them to impose such a fine I am a Union man and thought it was better to let them impose that fine, than to have the jury and Stallings to more costs by another trial, believing that the Governor would relieve the larger portion of it the Oct 1863 above facts are true.
